column4: changing the port won't help if someone is attempting to get in

on the contrary, they know ssh listens on port 22. If you pick a non-standard port, they will not know which port to probe. Since there are about 65535 possible ports, this is quite a good deterrent...
portscans don't take that long however
tcp portscans do. Most probers will try just a few standard ports and then move on if they don't responde...
